intro: Bauhinia ungulata var. ungulata, commonly known as the horned bauhinia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and clusters of showy, pink or white flowers. The plant belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. Its unique seed pods are elongated and often have a hooked or claw-like appearance, giving it its common name. Bauhinia ungulata var. ungulata is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking floral display.
